newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RESEARCH ALERT - Capel bullish on Fletcher Energy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Capel bullish on Fletcher Energy.

text.p: HSBC James Capel senior energy analyst Mario Traviati said on Thursday the brokerage had lifted its earnings estimate on Fletcher Energy.
He told Reuters that Capel had lifted its recommendation on the stock to buy just over a month ago.
Wellington brokers said a bullish report from Capel partly accounted for the 22 cent rise to NZ$4.03 in Fletcher Energy's share price on Thursday.
Traviati declined to release the report or details of the earnings upgrade. He raised the earnings estimate after Fletcher's quarterly report published on Tuesday.
In the quarterly report Fletcher Energy said total production for the September quarter was 12.5 million barrels of oil equivalent, up 11.0 percent on the same period in the 1995/96 year.

"If you compare Fletcher to the rest of the energy or oil and gas sector they are good value," Traviati said. "The earnings arithmetic on the company is very, very good. It was a good quarterly result and they have some good exploration wells coming up."
He said that on a cashflow multiple, Fletcher Energy stacked up as one of the cheapest stocks in the sector in Australasia or even globally.
Fletcher had some good wells on the exploration front. He singled out the Rahi well, near the Maui field offshore from the west coast of the North Island, as a particularly promising prospect.

Earlier on Thursday Fletcher Challenge Chief Executive Hugh Fletcher told shareholders that the Maui B oil project would produce oil worth NZ$570 million and add $100 million to Fletcher Energy's cashflow this year.
Fletcher said the oil project will generate cash flow before interest of around $260 million.
